item.title: Various approaches to talent management in Asia
item.description:
Source: ECN. Attracting and retaining skilled managers in Asia has become increasingly crucial for business leaders. A recent survey by the Economist Corporate Network (ECN) of 550 member companies in Asia revealed that 95% of CEOs actively engage in talent management practices. However, their level and type of involvement differ significantly. The report, Aligned for Success? Strategy, talent management and the role of the CEO in Asia, indicates that CEOs primarily focus on the strategic aspects of human capital, such as forecasting future workforce needs and organizational design...
